LanguageData.RV2_Settings_SearchToolInfo_Tip: Enabling this will hide all settings that do not contain the given search text. This includes the tooltip and the set value for settings.\n\nSome basic labels like section text will still be displayed.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Debug_MaxCachedInteractions: Going too big here might bloat your RAM, you have been warned
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_VoreQuirksEnabled_: Enable the quirk creation for pawns.\nThe quirks of each pawn can be accessed via the gizmo when the pawn is selected.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_FatalVoreEnabled_T: Enable vore with the intent to kill a prey.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_EndoVoreEnabled_Ti: Enable vore that does not directly lead to a pawns death.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_FeederVoreEnabled_: Enable pawns feeding a prey to a predator without doing any direct vore themself.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_AnimalsEnabled_Tip: Enable animals voring and being vored.\nCan also be disabled in the rules - this is more of a legacy setting.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_ShowVoreTab_Tip: Enable the vore tab.\nThe vore tab shows up on active predators and displays all of their prey in a fancier way than the hediffs.\nThe hediffs will still show up in the health tab though!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_ShowRMBVoreMenu_Ti: Enable the RMB context options when right-clicking on a pawn.\nThis includes options to reserve prey for feeding vore and proposing vore directly.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_RMBProposalsUseAut: RMB Proposals use auto vore interval
This will block vore proposals initatiated via the RMB menu if the auto vore cooldown for the given pawn has not elapsed yet.\n\nYou can configure this cooldown interval in the fine-tuning settings.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_ShowGizmo_Tip: Enable the RV2 gizmo containing Predator, Endo Prey and Fatal Prey designations, and the quirk menu.\nThe gizmo shows up whenever a pawn is selected.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_ScatEnabled_Tip: This will not affect any already existing items or curently ongoing Vore!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_BonesEnabled_Tip: This will not affect any already existing items or curently ongoing Vore!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_BackstoryGenitalsE: If this is enabled, backstories provided by RV2 are allowed to force pawns to have specific genitalia. This may result in futanari pawns being generated! If you disable this and get stuck with an "invalid" backstory, you need to overwrite the backstory via dev mode.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_GrapplingEnabled_T: Pawns can initiate a grapple move in which they attempt to throw their target to the ground and vore them.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_StrugglingEnabled_: Unwilling prey can struggle inside of predators to force their release from vore
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_SpecificVoreScenar:
In some cases pawns may be allowed to ignore the designations (predator, endo prey, fatal prey).

The setting is meant to provide some level of immersion, where in some scenarios the "will of the player" should be ignored.

This means some pawns may be fatally vored when they have the fatal vore designation disabled! The rest of the rules (like age) are still enforced!

Examples include but are not limited to manhunting animals and vore-kidnapping raiders.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_IgnoreDesignations: Note: Vore mental states may pick either endo or fatal goals
Note: Aggressive animals will almost always pick fatal goals!\n\nIncludes manhunting animals choosing to do vore
Note: Vore-napping raiders will always use the Store goal
Note: Enabling this means that pawns that predators can switch the vore goal (pleasure -> digest) on their prey even if they are not designated as fatal prey!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_AlwaysShowDesignat: By default you can only directly control the vore designations (predator, fatal, endo) of player controlled pawns. Turning this on will allow you to change hostile pawns designations.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Features_AddVoredPawnsToCol: Add vored pawns to colonist bar
Vored pawns will be drawn in their own group on the colonist bar
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ForbidDigestedCo: This setting allows you to automatically set corpses spawned by opening a vore product container to forbidden.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_DefaultStripBeha: This will only be used when predator and quirk either have no quirks to determine stripping OR their quirks cancel each other out
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_AutoHaulVoreCont: Automatically designate vore containers to be hauled, which will mean hauling pawns will take it to a dumping stockpile.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_AutoOpenVoreCont: Automatically designate vore containers to be opened, pawns generally prioritize opening over hauling, so they will pretty much always open the container before hauling the items.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ForbidNonFaction: Turning this on will automatically forbid vore containers produced by pawns that do not belong to the player faction.\n\nThis means your colonists won't automatically haul scat piles and the likes from wild animals.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ReformHumanoidsA: If this is set to false, RV2 will try to determine the minimum age required to participate in vore for the reformed pawn.\nThis can not affect non-humanoids due to complications with PawnKinds and their valid age ranges
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_SkipWarmupWhenAl: If a predator is already digesting prey, or churning digested prey, any new prey to be digested by the same part will skip the warmup phase, and immediately begin digesting.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ManhuntersVoreDo: Toggles manhunters voring downed pawns if there are no new pawns to attack.\nDue to the way the jobGiver for manhunters works, this is a simple true/false and not a chance like with kidnapping or hunting.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_HuntingAnimalsVo: When an animal uses its hunting AI, this setting can intercept the base game hunting and replace it with a job that makes the animal down their prey and then vore it.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_FailedTameVoreCh: Chance to be vored when taming failed

When a taming attempt fails, this is the chance that the tamer will be vored by the animal. Literal predator animals will use fatal vore, other animals will use endo vore.\n\nAnimal skill impacts this with a multiplier of 1.5x - 0.5x for animal skill 0 - 20 respectively
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_RaiderVorenappin: When a hostile pawn would kidnap a colonist, this setting can intercept the kidnap job and replace it with a job that makes the raider vore the colonist.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_VoreProposalCool: After a proposal there is a randomized cooldown. You can set the minimum and maximum range for the cooldown, with a detailed time explanation below the two settings.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ProposalTimeTick: The amount of time it takes to verbally propose to another pawn (the wait time until proposal acceptance is calculated)
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ForcedVoreChance: Denied proposal leads to forced vore fight chance:
The likelihood an initiator engages in combat with their target when they deny a proposal from them.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_PrisonersMustCon: Prisoners must agree to be vored
Enabling this means that prisoners can deny vore proposals.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_SlavesMustConsen: Slaves must agree to be vored
Enabling this means that slaves can deny vore proposals.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_AutoAcceptAnimal: Vore proposals directed at animals can be skipped if the proposer has a high animal skill.
Pawns with an animal skill equals or higher than this will always succeed in proposing to animals.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_AutoAcceptSocial: Vore proposals directed at humans can be skipped if the initiator has a much higher social skill than the target.
The social skill can factor in the targets social skill as well. Turning this on will subtract the targets social skill from the initiators social skill before checking the threshold.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ProposalDeniedNo: Notification type on denied vore proposal
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ProposalAccepted: Notification type on accepted vore proposal
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_FatalProposalAcc: Notification type on accepted fatal vore proposal
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_UnwrapOnDisposal: Unwrap products when releasing in disposal containers

When releasing fatally vored prey into a disposal building like disposal urns, should the original vore product container be removed?

False - After opening the urn, you need to open the vore product container as well
True - After opening the urn, the corpse and other items are directly dropped
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_MentalBreaksUseA: Mental breaks use auto vore rules
Forces pawns in mental breaks to follow rules flagged with auto-vore on
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_DefaultStruggleF: The default value for the vore path rules struggle mode
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_FeederVoreMinPre: The lower bound of prey to be fed into a predator by a feeder
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_FeederVoreMaxPre: The upper bound of prey to be fed into a predator by a feeder
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_StrugglingCreate: Whenever a prey actively struggles inside a predator, this will cause an interaction. This may result in spammed interaction logs.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_UseAlternativeMa: For true purveyors of art, only the best icon will do!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_GoalSwitchNotifi: Notification type on switched vore goal
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_FailedTameVoreNo: Notification type on failed taming vore
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_EjectStunDuratio: Whenever a pawn is released or ejected from a predator, they are stunned for this duration
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_BlockProposalIni:
Prevents pawns from proposing to other pawns while they are scheduled to work.

This does NOT prevent being proposed TO during work time.

Do note that if this is enabled, pawns whose proposal cooldown expires during work hours will immediately propose vore once they "finish their work shift"
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_AllowVisitorsAsA: By default only colonists and colony animals are valid targets for automatic vore proposals
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_AllowWildAnimalA: Allow wild animals as auto-proposal targets
By default only colonists and colony animals are valid targets for automatic vore proposals
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_PredatorAnimalsO: Predator animals only use digest goal

Predator animals are animals with the base game predator icon (warg, fox, jaguar, etc.). Whenever they vore someone through normal hunting or grappling, they only use digestive vore. Turning this off means wild animals may non-fatally vore pawns.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_FineTuning_ProposalRange_Ti: Only pawns within this range will be considered for vore proposals.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_VoreSpeedMultiplier_: Can be used to speed up many parts of the mod. Some things may not be impacted though, but it should influence swallow speed, passing between vore stages and digestion / processing of pawns.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_BodySizeToVoreCapaci: This ratio is used to calculate the base vore capacity.\nHumans at BodySize 1 with a ratio of 1.5 have a total vore capacity of 1.5, which fits 10 rats (0.15 BodySize each).
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_MinimumVoreCapacity_: You can override the calculated ratio with this setting. Every pawn, no matter their size will always have at least THIS much vore capacity.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_BaseInitAsPredatorCh: Base chance to initate as predator
This value serves as the starting point for predator role preference.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_BaseStripChance_Tip: This applies to random stripping! So if the predator + prey have decided they want to strip / not strip, this will not affect it!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_FallbackNutritionVal: Nutrition value is used to calculate the amount of resources generated from a pawn. This is normally calculated by asking the base game how much "meat" the pawn has. This settings serves as a fallback for pawns without meat (mechanoids, etc.)
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_PreventStarvingPrey_: Normally your prey should never starve, but people keep reporting issues, so this is your last resort to not have prey starve inside of predators. Only enable this if you have issues with starving prey, this basically checks if a prey is starving and then sets their food to 50%
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_PreventDrainingPreda: Normally prey steal food from their predator, turning this on will not deduct food from the predator, but still add it to the prey.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_CanStealFromNullNeed: Whether or not pawns can steal a need value when the other pawn doesn't have that need.\nAllows for stealing food from Mechanoids for example
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_InternalTemperature_: The temperature prey will experience while inside a predator.\n\nYou can override this by adding the RimVore2.InternalTemperatureExtension ModExtension to the ThingDef of any race, check RV2s /Patches folder for examples.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_AcidSavingThrowChanc: Likelihood of body parts not being digested
This applies to interrupted vore where the prey has entered the digestion stages and is afflicted with acid hediffs.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_AcidPityHealthFactor: Damage to body part when not digested
If the acid did not digest the body part (see above setting), how much damage is applied in relation to the body parts current health?
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_AcidImplantDamage_Ti: Damage applied to undigested implants - relative to current item health.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_ReformedPawnTraitCou: Number of traits for reformed pawns

When a pawn is reformed, how many traits can the new pawn have?\nThis does not overwrite the amount of traits naturally generated, only the amount of traits "inherited" from the original pawn and the predator doing the reformation
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_BaseProposalAcceptan: The base chance that a vore proposal is accepted.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_MaxProposalModifierV: The maximum a proposal can be modified with in regards to preferences.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_ProposalModifierPerP: Each preference quirk points impact to acceptance chance
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_MaxPawnTraits_Tip: With a special quirk predators may "steal" traits from other pawns - this number determines the maximum amount of traits a pawn can have\n\nIncreasing this too much breaks game balance, but if you use trait framework mods you can increase this number
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_TraitStealIgnoresLea: When stealing experience from another pawn the experience points are multiplied with the learning factor (burning passion, etc.)\n\nThis setting can toggle that behaviour off and will apply the raw XP that were actually stolen
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_DisableFactionImpact: Fatally voring any pawns from other factions will never impact the faction relations. What an absolute cheater you are.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_ImplantDestructionCh: The global chance for an implant to be destroyed upon digestion
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_DisableMentalStateCh: By default only specific mental states allow a pawn to be vored, enabling this will allow you to vore anyone in a mental state.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_AllowSelfVoreJumpOnP: Allow vore jump on player forced vore

Normally vore goal jumping (the predator deciding on their own to switch the goal on their prey) is only possible for auto-vore. Enabling this setting means the players chosen vore goal may be swapped out for something else if the predator has the required quirk.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_ExternalEjectAlwaysS: External eject attempts are always successful

Pawns can try to force other predators to eject their prey. This performs a random roll based on the pawns ejection strength stat. This cheat ignores the stat and guarantees success when attempting to eject.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Cheats_AllowMultipleExterna: Normally only one attempt to eject another predators prey is allowed.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_General_DisplayUnavailableR: Toggle showing unavailable vores with their given reason in the RMB menu
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_General_FeederVore_Tip: Will allow you to "Reserve" a pawn as prey and then make a third pawn feed that reserved prey to a predator.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Ideology_AutoVoreInterceptC: The chance that - if one is available - a chosen prey or alpha predator make auto-voring pawns target them and use the appropriate role on them. (eg If chosen prey available, pick it and set proposal to Predator role)
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Ideology_VoreFeastProposalA: In a vore feast, all participants spam vore proposals at each other, this can be used to make the voring happen faster and otherwise make proposals made in rituals more likely to be accepted
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_GrappleVerbSelection: The base % chance that the grapple verb is used when two pawns are in combat. This chance is further modified by quirks.\n\nEven if you set this to 100% the game might not pick the grapple, this is because base game calculates verb selection based on weight - there is currently no way of forcing a 100% chance to pick this quirk without breaking other mods, but a 100% weight will favor the grapple move heavily
The maximum weight that the verb can receive through modifiers. Base game is very very odd with how verb selection weights work, settings this value too high may result in odd combat behaviour!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_GrappleStrengthMelee:
The grapple strength of a pawn is divided by this value times their melee skill.

Example: 
Default divider of 5, Pawn has melee skill 7, base grapple strength is 10 -> (7/5)*10 = 14
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_UseAutoRules_Tip: Whether or not the grapple validation logic should use the rules flagges as "auto vore" or not
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_DefaultRequiredStrug: The amount of successful struggles required for a prey to break free from their predator\n\nThis value will be used as the fallback value for VorePath rules where the VorePathDef does not provide its own defaultRequiredStruggles value
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_DefaultStruggleChanc: The chance that a pawn manages to do a successful struggle during a vore tick. This is NOT the total chance of a prey to break free during struggling!\n\nIf you want a mechanic like that you can set the amount of required struggles to 0 and then lower this chance to a very low value.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_GrapplePawnsShareCel: During vore grapples the attacker and defender are placed on the same cell, when the vore combat stops they will automatically be "pushed" out of that cell in a random direction by the game. This may lead to your pawns getting out-of-position during combat, so you can turn it off.\n\nThis adds realism and looks neat, so you are very uncool if you turn this off B)
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_GrappleFailureStunDu: How long (in ticks) an attacker is stunned when their vore grapple fails
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_GrappleCanTimeout_Ti: This refers to started grapple-fights, if they are not finished before the time-out, the initiator will lose the grapple
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Combat_GrappleTimeoutTicks_: The time needed before a grapple times out.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_General_StrippingRandom_Tip: There will be a 50% chance to strip or not strip
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_General_StrippingAlways_Tip: The prey will always undress by default
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_General_StrippingNever_Tip: The prey will never undress by default
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_ResetAllRaritiesPoolList: Reset all quirk rarities in all pools
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_ResetAllRaritiesPool: Reset all quirk rarities in pool
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_SetAllRaritiesPool: Set all quirk rarities in pool
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_SetAllRaritiesPool_Tip: All quirks in this pool will be set to the given rarity
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Quirks_PoolInfo_Rarity_TipO: This rarity has been overriden and does not represent the intended rarity in the QuirkDef!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Quirks_PoolInfo_Rarity_TipD: This rarity is equal to the intended rarity in the QuirkDef
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_Target_PawnPickerNoMa: When playing on a map, you can select a pawn here to use as an example for the rules
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rule_RuleExplanation_NoPawn: Select a pawn to see if the rules would apply to them.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rule_RuleExplanation_DoesNo: {0} is currently NOT targeted by the parameters
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rule_RuleExplanation_DoesAp: {0} is currently targeted by the parameters
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_IdentifierType_Tip: What kind of pawn are the rules for?
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_IdentifierRole_Tip: Which role does the pawn play for the rule?
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_RuleStateOn: Currently ignoring previous rules and setting to "Enabled"
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_RuleStateOff: Currently ignoring previous rules and setting to "Disabled"
LanguageData.RV2_settings_Rules_UsesVorePathRules_Tip: With this option specific vore paths can be enabled or disabled.
LanguageData.RV2_settings_Rules_CanBeProposedTo_Tip: Allow vore proposals directed at this pawn? This does not imply predator or prey roles!
LanguageData.RV2_settings_Rules_CanForceFailedProposa: Can fight after failed vore proposals

Allow this pawn to fight other pawns if they deny this pawns vore proposal. Upon winning the vore fight, the initiator will then vore the target.\nThis does not imply predator or prey roles!\nThis may lead to this pawn being injured.
LanguageData.RV2_settings_Rules_CanBeForcedFailedProp: Can be fought after failed vore proposals

Allow this pawn to be fought after other denying a vore proposal. If this pawn loses the fight, the initiator will vore their target.\nThis does not imply predator or prey roles!\nThis may lead to this pawn being injured.
LanguageData.RV2_settings_Rules_CanBeForcedIfDowned_T: If this pawn is downed and another colonist proposes vore to them, they will automatically accept the proposal.\nThis does not imply predator or prey roles!
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_Enabled_Tip: Allows you to disable the VorePath entirely for the pawns
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_AllowedInAutoVore_Tip: Disabling this means the pawns can not use this path for automatically initiated vore
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_Container_Tip: Setting this will "wrap" the products of this vore path. Normally this is to be used to contain the products of digestive vore.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_CorpseProcessing_Tip:
This controls how produced corpses are treated when they are put into the container. This does not affect items or apparel carried by the pawn, only the corpse itself!

Dessicate - Produces skeletons
Rot - Sets the corpse to half of its rot time to become a skeleton
Destroy - Removes the corpse entirely
None - Leaves the corpse alone.
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_StruggleForceMode_Tip: The occasion in which prey will struggle when they are vored with this vore path.\n\Vore is considered forced when voring downed pawns, forcing proposals or being vored by wild animals and raiders
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_RequiredStruggles_Tip: How many successful struggles the prey needs to escape their predator
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_AutoVoreOn: Currently allowed to automatically initiate vore\nClick to turn off
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_AutoVoreOff: Currently not allowed to automatically initiate vore\nClick to turn on
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_DesignatedPredatorOn: Currently automatically designated as predator\nClick to turn off
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_DesignatedPredatorOff: Currently automatically designated as non-predator\nClick to turn on
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_DesignatedEndoPreyOn: Currently automatically designated as endo prey\nClick to turn off
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_DesignatedEndoPreyOff: Currently automatically designated as non endo prey\nClick to turn on
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_DesignatedFatalPreyOn: Currently automatically designated as fatal prey\nClick to turn off
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_Rules_DesignatedFatalPreyOf: Currently automatically designated as non fatal prey\nClick to turn on
LanguageData.RV2_Settings_ChangePrompt_DefaultStruggl: The default struggle mode has changed. Would you like to apply this change to all existing vore path settings? \n\nThis will set all settings with "{0}" to "{1}", but won't touch any other ones.
